reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 532/97: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY TO MUNICIPALITY OF CHATHAM-KENT
reg_info.reg_name_text: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY TO MUNICIPALITY OF CHATHAM-KENT
reg_info.act_under: Planning Act   Loi sur l’aménagement du territoire

content.content: 1. The Minister's authority under section 51 of the Act to approve plans of subdivision and section 50 of the Condominium Act to approve or exempt condominium descriptions is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 1.
content.raw_html: 1. The Minister's authority under section 51 of the Act to approve plans of subdivision and section 50 of the Condominium Act to approve or exempt condominium descriptions is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 1.

content.content: 2. (1) The Minister's authority to give approval under section 51 of the Act as it read on March 27, 1995 and continued by section 74.1 of the Act is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent with respect to applications for approval of plans of subdivision whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 2 (1). (2) The Minister's authority to give approval under section 51 of the Act as it read on March 27, 1995 and continued by section 74.1 of the Act is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent with respect to applications for approval or exemption of condominium descriptions whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 2. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 2 (2).
content.raw_html:
2. (1) The Minister's authority to give approval under section 51 of the Act as it read on March 27, 1995 and continued by section 74.1 of the Act is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent with respect to applications for approval of plans of subdivision whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 2 (1).

(2) The Minister's authority to give approval under section 51 of the Act as it read on March 27, 1995 and continued by section 74.1 of the Act is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent with respect to applications for approval or exemption of condominium descriptions whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 2. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 2 (2).

content.content: 3. (1) The authority of the Minister under subsection 297 (10) of the Municipal Act to approve by-laws under clause 297 (1) (b) or (c) of the Municipal Act in respect of any highway or part of a highway shown on a registered plan of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946 is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 3 (1). (2) The delegation does not apply to a by-law passed under clauses 297 (1) (b) or (c) of the Municipal Act before January 1, 1998 by the council of the County of Kent or of a municipality that formed part of the County of Kent for municipal purposes. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 3 (2).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) The authority of the Minister under subsection 297 (10) of the Municipal Act to approve by-laws under clause 297 (1) (b) or (c) of the Municipal Act in respect of any highway or part of a highway shown on a registered plan of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946 is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 3 (1).

(2) The delegation does not apply to a by-law passed under clauses 297 (1) (b) or (c) of the Municipal Act before January 1, 1998 by the council of the County of Kent or of a municipality that formed part of the County of Kent for municipal purposes. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 3 (2).

content.content: 4. (1) The authority of the Minister under subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act to approve the laying out of highways less than 20 metres in width is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 4 (1). (2) The delegation does not apply to any application for an approval under subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act made in respect of land in the County of Kent before January 1, 1998. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 4 (2).
content.raw_html:
4. (1) The authority of the Minister under subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act to approve the laying out of highways less than 20 metres in width is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 4 (1).

(2) The delegation does not apply to any application for an approval under subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act made in respect of land in the County of Kent before January 1, 1998. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 4 (2).

content.content: 5. (1) The authority of the Minister under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act to give his or her consent to orders amending plans of subdivision registered after March 26, 1946 is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 5 (1). (2) The delegation does not apply to any application for a consent under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act made in respect of land in the County of Kent before January 1, 1998. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 5 (2).
content.raw_html:
5. (1) The authority of the Minister under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act to give his or her consent to orders amending plans of subdivision registered after March 26, 1946 is delegated to the council of the Municipality of Chatham-Kent in respect of all the land situate in the municipality. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 5 (1).

(2) The delegation does not apply to any application for a consent under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act made in respect of land in the County of Kent before January 1, 1998. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 5 (2).

content.content: 6. (1) If any of the authority delegated to the council is in turn delegated by the council to a committee of council or an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 6 (1). (2) The delegation of authority set out in this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 6 (2).
content.raw_html:
6. (1) If any of the authority delegated to the council is in turn delegated by the council to a committee of council or an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 6 (1).

(2) The delegation of authority set out in this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 532/97, s. 6 (2).

content.content: 7. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 532/97, s. 7.
